definition: epiglottis
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
to loathe
epiglottitis

sentences.english: Cut through the windpipe the jugular the epiglottis the hyoid the tongue.
sentences.chinese: 割開她的氣管，頸靜脈，會厭軟骨，舌骨和舌頭。

sentences.english: Hemorrhages of the epiglottis and larynx appear to vary with the conditions under which the disease is observed.
sentences.chinese: 會厭和喉頭的出血因觀察疾病時的條件不同而異。

sentences.english: Objective To sum up the clinical experience for the diagnosis and treatment of acute epiglottitis.
sentences.chinese: 目的總結急性會厭炎的診斷和治療經驗，提高療效。

sentences.english: Acute epiglottitis is usually caused by a bacterial infection.
sentences.chinese: 急性會厭炎，一般多因感染所造成。

sentences.english: That closure is what causes the hiccup sound.
sentences.chinese: 會厭就是打嗝聲音發出的地方。

sentences.english: Demonstrate management of patients with upper airway infection suspected of having epiglottitis .
sentences.chinese: 展現對於疑似有會厭炎之上呼吸道感染患者的處方式。

sentences.english: Methods 180 cases clinical data of acute epiglottitis are summarized and analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 方法對180例急性會厭炎臨牀資料進行總結和分析。

sentences.english: The incidence of epiglottitis has decreased since the introduction of the HIB (Haemophilus influenzae B) vaccine.
sentences.chinese: 自從引入流感嗜血菌疫苗後，會厭炎發病率明顯降低。

sentences.english: Conclusion This therapy with ESED is effective on chronic hypertrophic laryngitis.
sentences.chinese: 結論會厭逐瘀湯加味治療慢性肥厚性喉炎有確切療效。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the treatment of acute epiglottitis and care.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討急性會厭炎的診治和護理。

definition: (coll.) to go crazy/to lose it/demented/unhinged
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to cease to be faithful
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
